title: Ayatollah era coming to end? Iran's Khamenei names successors; son's name missing
content: Facing an uncertain future amid escalating tensions, Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei has reportedly designated three senior clerics as potential successors, signaling a shift away from dynastic succession by excluding his son, Mojtaba. This unprecedented move coincides with Khamenei's retreat to a secure bunker following threats from the US and Israel, highlighting the fragility surrounding Iran's leadership.

title: IND vs ENG: 'Shubman-Pant were speaking loudly in Hindi' - Tendulkar reveals genius 'mind game' vs England
content: Sachin Tendulkar praised Rishabh Pant's innovative paddle sweep, calling it a calculated move, not an accident. He also noted Shubman Gill and Pant's on-field communication tactics to disrupt the bowler. Their 209-run partnership followed Yashasvi Jaiswal's century, putting England's bowlers under pressure. Gill scored 147, while Pant reached his century with a six before India's innings concluded at 471.

title: 8 killed in Brazil hot air balloon horror; video shows blaze in sky
content: A hot air balloon accident in Praia Grande, Brazil resulted in multiple fatalities. Initial reports confirm eight deaths. Rescue teams are searching for other passengers. The balloon caught fire mid-air before crashing. Two survivors are receiving medical care. Jorginho Mello, the state governor, expressed shock. An investigation into the cause of the fire is underway. Authorities are working to identify the victims. The incident raises concerns about flight safety.

title: Watch: Israel strikes Iran's Isfahan nuclear site again
content: A senior Israeli military official confirmed a second wave of strikes on Iran's Isfahan nuclear facility, targeting centrifuge production sites. These renewed attacks follow initial airstrikes on June 13, aiming to cripple Iran's uranium enrichment capabilities. Alongside Isfahan, Natanz and Fordo were also targeted, escalating the shadow war and raising concerns about regional stability.

title: How Bill Gates and Melinda Gates reacted when their daughter announced her startup
content: Phoebe Gates, daughter of Bill Gates, has launched Phia, an e-commerce app co-founded with Sophia Kianni. The platform utilizes AI to compare prices across numerous websites, offering users a comprehensive view of both new and second-hand fashion items. Bill Gates initially expressed concern about potential financial requests and involvement but ultimately supported Phoebe's entrepreneurial endeavor.

title: IND vs ENG: History at Headingley! Jasprit Bumrah breaks Wasim Akram's record
content: Jasprit Bumrah's crucial breakthroughs on Day 2 against England, including Ben Duckett's key wicket, propelled India forward. Despite a batting slump, Bumrah's early wicket of Zak Crawley set a positive tone. Surpassing Wasim Akram, Bumrah now holds the record for most wickets by an Asian bowler in SENA countries with 147, solidifying his status as India's premier overseas fast-bowling export.

title: GitHub CEO to software engineers: ‘Key for winning’ AI coding tools is in ….
content: GitHub CEO Thomas Dohmke emphasizes the importance of developers retaining hands-on coding skills alongside AI tools. He warns against over-reliance on AI-generated code, advocating for a flexible workflow where developers can seamlessly switch between AI assistance and direct coding.

title: Ahmedabad crash aftermath: Air India begins Rs 25 lakh interim payouts
content: Air India has initiated interim compensation of Rs 25 lakh each for the families of the deceased and survivors of the Ahmedabad plane crash on June 12. Payments have been made to three families, with others being processed. This is in addition to the Rs 1 crore compensation from Tata Sons.

title: ITR: Are capital gains from MFs taxed differently? New LTCG, STCG rules
content: When filing income tax returns for AY 2025-26, understanding capital gains taxation from mutual funds is crucial. Both old and new tax regimes tax these gains. Long-term gains from equity funds are taxed at 12.50% (exceeding Rs 1.25 lakh), while short-term gains are taxed at 20%.

title: SpaceX test rocket explosion: Elon Musk shares ‘three-word’ reply
content: A SpaceX Starship upper stage exploded during an engine test at Starbase in South Texas, resulting in the spacecraft's loss and damage to the test area. This incident occurred just before the planned 10th flight test of the massive rocket, a key component of Elon Musk's Mars colonization vision.

title: IND vs ENG: Rishabh Pant better than MS Dhoni? Ex-India cricketer says YES after Headingley heroics
content: Sanjay Manjrekar lauded Rishabh Pant as India's greatest wicketkeeper-batter after his stunning century against England. Pant's remarkable innings broke records, surpassing MS Dhoni with the most Test centuries by an Indian wicketkeeper. His fifth Test century in SENA countries also set a new benchmark for Asian batters, solidifying his reputation in challenging overseas conditions.

title: ‘Mayday’: Guwahati-Chennai flight aborts landing; runs thin on fuel
content: The pilot of IndiGo flight 6E-6764 (A321), which took off from Guwahati at 4.40pm, attempted to land at Chennai around 7.45pm, but decided to ‘go around’ after the landing gear touched the runway in a procedure called ‘balked landing’.

title: 'Hissing door mid-air': AI flight to Hong Kong spooks flyers; crew use napkins to 'fix' issue
content: An Air India flight from Delhi to Hong Kong experienced a mid-air door malfunction, causing unsettling noises and shaking. Flight attendants used napkins to mitigate the issue, and the flight landed safely. Similar incidents have occurred on Boeing 787s previously, though experts assure that such door issues don't compromise flight safety, highlighting the redundancy in safety measures.

title: 'Covered trench with plastic': Wife killed, buried in 10-foot-deep pit outside home
content: Faridabad police unearthed the decomposed body of Tanu Rajput, a 25-year-old woman, from a pit outside her in-laws' house in Roshan Nagar, nearly two months after her disappearance. Her husband, Arun Singh, and his parents are suspected of murdering her and burying her body.

title: 'People are too sweet in Bengaluru': Old couple invites creator for 'local homely food'
content: A Delhi musician's quest for authentic Bengaluru cuisine led to an unexpected and heartwarming encounter with an elderly couple. He requested a home-cooked breakfast, and they welcomed him with open arms, sharing food, music, and heartfelt conversation. The video of this cross-cultural exchange, celebrating the unifying power of food, has gone viral, highlighting the kindness and warmth of human connection.

title: IND vs ENG | Pant's love story with No. 5 - a batting romance born in 2016
content: Only Rishabh Pant can clear the ropes comfortably with the one hand coming off, only he can deflate the opposition in a single session of audacious stroke play. He brought up his Test century No 7 with a one-handed six over mid-on. He celebrated with a somersault, entertained the crowd further as the showstopper put on an another box-office performance on the England soil.

title: 'This ain't aid, it's death': Gaza food distribution plagued by violence and shortage
content: In Gaza, Palestinians face life-threatening conditions daily in their desperate search for food, amidst scarce aid and escalating violence. Israeli troops have reportedly opened fire near aid routes, while looters target those carrying supplies. The UN warns of an apocalyptic situation, with aid insufficient to prevent starvation as desperate residents risk everything for basic necessities.

title: Bizarre! Fan shows up with two cobras and a monkey during Test match - viral moment
content: The first Test between Sri Lanka and Bangladesh ended in a tense draw, marked by a delayed declaration from Bangladesh and a resilient Sri Lankan defense. Amidst the on-field drama, a snake charmer with cobras and a monkey added a surreal touch to the 'Naagin Derby'. Najmul Hossain Shanto's twin centuries and Nayeem Hasan's five-wicket haul highlighted the high-scoring affair.

title: Honeymoon murder case: Meghalaya court remands Sonam, Raj to 13-day judicial custody
content: Sonam Raghuvanshi and Raj Kushwaha have been remanded to judicial custody for the murder of Raja Raghuvanshi during their honeymoon in Meghalaya. Arrested along with three accomplices, they are under investigation by a special team. The victim's family alleges a conspiracy, demanding further investigation and narcoanalysis tests to uncover the motive behind the murder.

title: IND vs ENG: Shubman Gill's first pep talk as Test captain fired up Team India – WATCH
content: Shubman Gill captained India in the first Test against England at Headingley, urging his team to secure an early victory after a dominant batting performance. India posted 471 in their first innings, propelled by centuries from Gill (147), Rishabh Pant (134), and Yashasvi Jaiswal (101).

title: IND vs ENG: 'Rishabh Pant has his own computer' — Ravi Shastri breaks down what makes him special
content: Ravi Shastri lauded Rishabh Pant's impressive century in the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy Test. Pant surpassed MS Dhoni with his seventh Test century. Shastri described Pant as an 'outrageous' and entertaining player. Sunil Gavaskar praised Pant's century, contrasting with earlier criticism. Shastri noted India's aggressive run rate. He hoped for overcast conditions to aid India's bowling attack.

title: Are Indians being forced to leave Israel? What embassy said
content: Amidst rising Middle East tensions, the Indian embassy in Israel refuted claims of forcing Indian citizens to leave, dismissing a fake social media post. The embassy encouraged citizens to rely on official channels for accurate updates and register for assistance.

title: Gadkari calls work done till now 'news reel'; adds 'film abhi baaki hain'
content: Nitin Gadkari hinted at a larger role in 2029, framing his past contributions as a mere "news reel" compared to the "real film" yet to come. He emphasized party loyalty and his commitment to assigned duties, while prioritizing initiatives to prevent farmer suicides in Vidarbha. Gadkari also cited population growth as a barrier to India's economic progress.

title: IND vs ENG: Emotional scenes! Shubman Gill breaks down after scoring 147
content: Shubman Gill marked his Test captaincy debut with a brilliant 147 against England at Headingley, leading India's charge in the first Test. Despite falling short of a double century due to a mistimed shot, his innings was crucial in India's quest for an early series advantage.

title: Reducing dependence, countering China: India’s scheme for rare earth minerals
content: India is looking to reduce its reliance on China for rare earth minerals with a Rs 3,500-Rs 5,000 crore scheme to boost domestic production. This initiative comes as China's export restrictions on rare earths have raised concerns in the Indian automotive and renewable energy sectors.

title: Did Israel strikes trigger earthquake in Tehran? Tremors could be linked to Iran nukes
content: An earthquake of magnitude 5.1 hit northern Iran. This event occurred amidst ongoing Israeli airstrikes. Some analysts speculate a possible link to Iran's nuclear program. Semnan province, near the epicenter, houses key nuclear and missile infrastructure. Iran denies pursuing nuclear weapons. The incident has heightened tensions in West Asia. Investigations are underway to determine the cause of the tremor.

title: IND vs ENG: Pant's front-flip celebration after century goes viral - Watch
content: Rishabh Pant captivated Headingley with a dazzling century, punctuated by a viral front-flip celebration. His aggressive innings, featuring 10 fours and four sixes, propelled India past 400, supported by Shubman Gill's century. Pant's acrobatic display, reminiscent of his IPL antics, underscored his triumphant comeback from injury, adding a memorable moment to the Test match.

title: 1st Test Day 2: Is Gill still wearing black socks? What if he's found guilty?
content: Shubman Gill's impressive Test captaincy debut at Headingley was slightly overshadowed when he sported black socks, violating ICC regulations mandating white, cream, or light grey. While his career-best 147 anchored India's innings, the sock choice drew attention, potentially leading to a reprimand or fine.

title: IND vs ENG: India's highest Test totals in England: Can Shubman's team break the record at Leeds?
content: Shubman Gill's captaincy debut began spectacularly as India dominated England in Leeds. Yashasvi Jaiswal scored a century on his first English innings, while Gill made his maiden overseas Test century, both achieving unique milestones. India ended day one at 359/3, aiming to build a massive first-innings lead, reminiscent of their victorious 2002 Leeds performance.

title: From 'stupid, stupid' to 'superb, superb' - Gavaskar lauds Pant's hundred
content: Rishabh Pant's audacious century at Headingley marked a significant turnaround, silencing past criticism from Sunil Gavaskar. Pant's measured approach, combining patience with aggressive strokes, allowed him to dominate the tiring bowlers. His partnership with Shubman Gill put India in a commanding position, transforming critique into admiration.

title: Delhi weather: Sudden rain brings relief to capital; IMD issues yellow alert
content: Delhi experienced a welcome change in weather as rain showers swept through various areas. RK Puram, Dhaula Kuan, and Delhi Cantt saw significant downpours. The India Meteorological Department has issued a yellow alert, forecasting rainfall from Friday to Monday. The monsoon is approaching the National Capital Region, with an expected arrival by June 24.

title: IND vs ENG: 3011-day wait ends in heartbreak! Karun Nair falls for four-ball duck on Test comeback
content: After an eight-year wait, Karun Nair's Test comeback was short-lived as he was dismissed for a duck by Ben Stokes. Nair, who previously scored a triple century against England in 2016, earned his recall after impressive domestic performances. Despite the disappointing return, he cherished receiving his comeback cap from Sunil Gavaskar.

title: Taylor Swift breaks from Blake Lively: Betrayal in $400M lawsuit
content: The celebrated friendship between Taylor Swift and Blake Lively is reportedly strained due to a $400 million lawsuit involving Justin Baldoni and Lively. Private text messages from Lively, presented in court, have allegedly wounded Swift, exposing a side of Lively she hadn't anticipated.

title: Dressed as inspector, 20-year-old visits Kolkata police station to impress girlfriend
content: A 20-year-old man named Diptendu Bag was apprehended at Entally Police Station for masquerading as a Bengal Police inspector. Bag, dressed in a police uniform and accompanied by his girlfriend, aroused suspicion due to his unusual behavior. His inconsistent answers during questioning and claims of a rapid promotion raised further doubts.

title: Spy chief flip-flop? After Trump's 2nd rebuke over Iran intel, Tulsi Gabbard shifts tone
content: A public dispute has erupted within the US national security apparatus as Tulsi Gabbard adjusted her assessment of Iran's nuclear ambitions, following a direct contradiction from President Trump. Gabbard now acknowledges Iran could potentially develop a nuclear weapon within weeks to months if it chooses to proceed, a revision prompted by the president's strong disagreement and amidst ongoing tensions regarding the Iran-Israel conflict.

title: 'Destroying evidence': Rahul Gandhi targets EC again; poll body reacts
content: Rahul Gandhi has intensified his criticism of the Election Commission, alleging a lack of transparency and the destruction of vital election data. The EC defended its decision to erase CCTV footage 45 days post-election, citing voter privacy and potential misuse. Officials stated that releasing webcasting footage could compromise voter security and contravene legal provisions, despite claims of promoting democratic integrity.

title: 'Yoga is pause button'; PM Modi's strong message for world 'going through unrest'
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi led the 11th International Yoga Day celebrations in Visakhapatnam, emphasizing yoga's role in fostering peace amidst global tensions. He highlighted yoga's universal appeal, transcending boundaries and uniting humanity.

title: IND vs ENG: Rishabh Pant breaks MS Dhoni's record, slams seventh Test century
content: Rishabh Pant's impressive record in England continued as he scored his seventh Test century at Headingley in Leeds. Pant reached his century in 119 balls, marking his slowest Test century. This was his fourth century against England and his third on English soil, solidifying his reputation as a premier red-ball batter for India.

title: 'Giving them two weeks': Trump’s timeless countdown returns; this time with Iran
content: Donald Trump has repeatedly stated he will decide whether to launch a military strike on Iran within the next two weeks. This timeline echoes a pattern from his first term, where he frequently used the "two weeks" promise for various announcements that often failed to materialize.

title: ‘Disturbing departure from moral traditions’: Sonia Gandhi on govt silence on Gaza, Iran
content: Sonia Gandhi has strongly criticized the Modi government's silence on Israel's actions in Gaza and its strike on Iran, calling it a departure from India's diplomatic traditions. She accused the government of abandoning its commitment to a two-state solution and failing to condemn Israel's escalation, urging India to use its diplomatic leverage to promote dialogue and de-escalation in West Asia.

title: IND vs ENG: 'Kya hi baat hai teri bhai' - Gill’s banter with Pant lights up Day 2
content: Shubman Gill and Rishabh Pant's on-field camaraderie shone through during India's dominant batting display at Headingley. Gill's witty comment on Pant's elegant leave was caught on the stump mic, delighting fans. Pant, in turn, cautioned Gill about a risky shot, showcasing their mutual understanding and contributing to a defining 200-plus run partnership.

title: IndiGo Flight Declared 'Mayday' Due To Low Fuel, Landed Safely: Sources
content: Budget carrier IndiGo's Guwahati-Chennai flight, with 168 passengers, made an emergency landing in Bengaluru after pilots declared 'mayday' due to "insufficient fuel", said sources.

title: Air India Plane Crash: 9 Days On, Process To Identify Victims Continues
content: Nine days after the Ahmedabad plane crash, the process to identify several victims is still underway as the authorities have asked eight families to submit the DNA sample of another relative, as the previous ones failed to match.

title: "Saw Bodies, Blasts": Indian Students Return From Iran, Future Uncertain
content: As part of Operation Sindhu, three charter flights - two from Iran's Mashhad and one from Turkmenistan's Ashgabat - have successfully brought back 827 Indian nationals so far.

title: Video: Maharashtra Teacher Naps, Snores For 30 Minutes In Class Full Of Children
content: A man was sprawled on a chair with his legs up on the table, sleeping soundly and snoring - there would have been nothing unusual about this except for the fact that it was captured at a school in Maharashtra and the man in question is a teacher.

title: Air India Starts Releasing Interim Compensation Of Rs 25 Lakh To Crash Victims, Survivors
content: Air India on Saturday said it has started releasing the interim compensation of Rs 25 lakh each to the families of the victims and survivors of the June 12 plane crash.

title: Days After Her "Papa, Save Me" SOS, Indian Student In Iran Returns Home
content: "Papa, save me," an Indian student who was stuck in conflict-hit Iran wrote to her father on June 13. Today, she met her father after landing in Delhi in an evacuation flight arranged by India under 'Operation Sindhu'.

title: CBI Finds Losses Over Rs 4,200 Crore In JNPA Dredging Project Corruption Case
content: Financial losses of over Rs 4,200 crore have been flagged by the CBI in a corruption case linked to the Jawaharlal Nehru Port Authority dredging project. The case has exposed deep-rooted corruption, inflated costs, and rigged contracts.

title: Fresh UK Crew To Arrive In Kerala With Spares To Inspect F-35B: Sources
content: A team from the British navy carrying spare parts will arrive in Kerala to inspect F-35B Lightning II stealth fighter jet, which has been stranded in Thiruvananthapuram for a week, sources have told NDTV.

title: Trump Says 'Mindbogglingly Historic' Deal With Harvard Will Be Announced Soon
content: Earlier, the president had accused Harvard of failing to clamp down and perpetuating antisemitism. He had terminated $2 billion in grants and also tried to ban the school from granting admission to international students.

title: "It Is Doing Wonders": Pak Defence Minister Praises Civil-Military "Hybrid Model"
content: Pakistan's Defence Minister Khawaja Asif and a close aide of ruling PML-N president and former prime minister Nawaz Sharif said the country is being governed under a "hybrid model" in which the military enjoys a major power share.

title: On Camera, 8 Killed In Hot Air Balloon Horror In Brazil
content: At least eight people were killed after a hot-air balloon carrying 21 passengers crashed on Saturday in Brazil's southern state of Santa Catarina, local and state officials said.

title: Marriage Proposal Turned Down, Man Shoots At Two Sisters In Haryana
content: A man opened fire at two sisters in Haryana's Jind district after their parents reportedly turned down his proposal to marry one of the siblings.

title: Rs 100 Crore Fake GST Refund Scam Busted By CBI
content: The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) has launched a major crackdown in a case involving bogus GST refund claims amounting to nearly Rs 100 crore, allegedly orchestrated through fake export bills.

title: Sonam, Raj Kushwaha Sent To 13-Day Judicial Custody In Honeymoon Murder Case
content: A local court here on Saturday remanded Sonam Raghuvanshi and her alleged boyfriend Raj to 13-day judicial custody in connection with the murder of Indore businessman Raja Raghuvanshi.

title: Madhya Pradesh To Hike Ladli Behna Payout, Opposition Flags Towering Debt
content: Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Dr Mohan Yadav has announced that the monthly financial assistance for women under the Ladli Behna scheme will be increased to Rs 1,500 from Diwali.

title: India Assures Nepal Of Evacuating Its Citizens From Conflict-Hit Iran
content: India on Saturday assured Nepal that it will evacuate its nationals currently stranded in Iran amid its conflict with Israel.

title: US Asks Student Visa Applicants To Set Social Media Profile Privacy To "Public"
content: All applicants for F, M, and J non-immigrant US visas which are meant for students will have to adjust the privacy settings on all of their social media profiles to "public", the State Department said in a statement today.

title: On Camera, Bus Rams Women Waiting At Bus Stop In Kerala
content: At least three people were injured, one of them critically, when a private bus rammed passengers waiting at a bus stop in Kerala's Thrissur.

title: US Experts Join ONGC Team To Contain Assam Gas Blowout
content: A three-member team of well control specialists from Cudd Well Control in the USA have begun intensive site preparations to bring under control the situation at the site of a gas blowout at a well in the Rudrasagar oil field of ONGC.

title: Noida Man Heading To Airport Dies As Cab Driver "Falls Asleep": Family
content: A man from Noida has died allegedly after the driver of the cab he had booked fell asleep and the car rammed a stationary tempo, the family has alleged.

title: DNPA calls for protection of copyright in AI model training on news content
content: The DNPA, which represents traditional news publishers with a digital presence, said that AI model developers should compensate news publishers fairly for training on their content

title: MP cites need for skywalks to link Ernakulam Town, Thripunithura railway stations with adjacent metro stops
content: A joint meeting of officials from KMRL, the Railway, local bodies, and MLAs must be convened to chart out a concrete plan of action, since the intermodal linkages can serve as a model for integrated urban transport and significantly enhance the commuting experience in Kochi, says Hibi Eden

title: Treat Shabir Shah without delay, J&K leaders appeal to Home Minister
content: CPI(M) leader Tarigami, J&K Apni Party president Altaf Bukhari and PDP chief Mehbooba appeal for bail on medical grounds

title: Invoking anti-gangster law to counter one communal violence incident triggered by a social media post is misuse: SC
content: “The power conferred upon the State cannot be wielded as an instrument of harassment or intimidation, particularly where political motivations may be at play,” says Justice Sandeep Mehta’s judgment

title: Flood-like situation in South Bengal as rain, DVC water release raise river levels
content: Paschim Midnapore, Bankura, Hooghly, and Howrah among affected districts; evacuation, relief efforts underway

title: Kerala student returns in special flight from Iran
content: She had gone to Tehran in September 2024 to pursue the MBBS programme at Shahid Beheshti University of Medical Sciences, Tehran

title: Delay in FoB construction on Bengaluru-Mysuru highway raises pedestrian safety concerns
content: Of the 24 planned structures, only a handful have reached completion, with many still at the foundation or pillar stage though the construction officially commenced in October 2024

title: Cop turns his composition into video album featuring colleagues
content: Assistant sub-inspector A. Ajithdev has composed nearly 10 songs since joining the force 23 years ago

title: Enough Plus One seats in schools in State:  Sivankutty
content: General Education Minister says  1,13,476 Plus One seats are vacant across the State after the main allotment process, adding revised mid-day meal menu has been rolled out after proper study

title: Rohith Vemula Bill proposes to cut govt. aid to institutions for violating rules
content: The government proposes to enact the legislation to eliminate caste- and identity-based discrimination in educational institutions

title: ‘Youth from families who benefited from land reforms, welfare schemes are now swayed by Hindutva politics’
content: The KPCC committee, which visited Dakshina Kannada district and met people from all walks of life, has submitted its interim report looking at the reasons for the communal polarisation there

title: Chennai-bound Indigo flight makes emergency landing in Bengaluru
content: Indigo spokesperson said the airline made a “mayday” call before it landed in Bengaluru, as it "ran out of fuel".

title: Disfigured skull found in vacant plot at Kumbalanghi
content: The skull, with the jaw allegedly missing, will be sent to the police surgeon for DNA profiling and gender identification

title: Local bodies achieving complete yoga integration will be honoured: Veena George
content: Move intends to inspire local bodies and encourage widespread adoption of yoga practices at grassroots level. Strong intervention by AYUSH department aims to popularise yoga across the State

title: India Post helps transform geolocation with DIGIPIN
content: The 10- digit alpha-numeric code represents geographic coordinates, developed by creating a uniform 4x4 metre grid of the country

title: Kerala Tourism remains most visited travel website in the country
content: It surpassed the Union government’s ‘Incredible India’ website that came second, according to analytics company Similarweb.

title: BJP worker found dead in Bengal’s Hooghly, party alleges ‘political murder’
content: The man’s family alleges that Trinamool Congress workers had assaulted him in the past. The ruling party says the BJP is ‘adding political colour’ to the tragedy

title: Rust and resolve: Thrissur’s anti-drug installation sends a bold message
content: With scrap metal and vision, sculptor Davinchi Suresh gives form to Thrissur’s war on drugs. The sculpture is created from over 3.5 tonnes of discarded metal — gear wheels, nuts, bolts, and sheet metal

title: Project on the anvil to convert old diesel-powered KSRTC buses into e-buses
content: The project will see the engines, gearbox and transmission systems of KSRTC buses older than five years replaced with battery, battery management system and Motor Control Unit.

title: Welfare trust demands fair wages, social security for domestic workers
content: Speakers at the National Domestic Workers’ Welfare Trust meeting in Tiruchi demand dignity of labour for the workers, a comprehensive law to protect their rights

title: Free cancer screening camps evoke poor response in Tiruchi; health officials blame it on ignorance, social stigma
content: Screening camps are set up in all 18 UPHCs and 36 health and wellness centres in the city; each centre has a doctor, four staff nurses, six urban health nurses, and women health volunteers

title: Central Travancore politics dives into floodwaters as local body polls loom
content: Environmental issues have surged to the centre of the political discourse as parties crank up their campaign machinery.  Political battlelines are being drawn not just on land, but across the rivers and lakes of region

title: Youth Congress activists protest against Minister demanding solution to sea incursion threat at Kannamaly
content: The government accused of ignoring repeated calls to extend tetrapod-based seawall protection along vulnerable coastal stretches

title: Chief Justice calls for coordination between government offices and legal services authority
content: Delivers inaugural address at ‘Legal Services Summit 2025’ organised by Thiruvananthapuram District Legal Services Authority

title: Operation Sindoor reflects control, inner strength of troops, gained by practising yoga: Rajnath Singh
content: Defence Minister says yoga makes practitioner proactive, not reactive, as seen during the operation; reiterates that Sindoor is not over yet; says India is fully prepared to take “all kinds of action” against terrorism

title: ₹165 crore spent on welfare of fisherfolk in 2024-25, says Fisheries Minister
content: Educational and sports awards instituted by the Kerala Fishermen’s Welfare Fund Board distributed to students

title: Nellore Municipal Corporation cracks whip on illegal layouts
content: Municipal staff demolish unauthorised constructions in four layouts including Garden City Extension in Ambapuram, Sri Sai Brundavanam Smart City Phase A&B in Gudipallipadu, and Sri Sai Nagar Phase-I and II in the city

title: Orioles' Rutschman (oblique) on IL for first time
content: Orioles catcher Adley Rutschman was placed on the injured list for the first time in his career Saturday due to an oblique strain.

title: Misiorowski perfect into 7th, sets rookie record
content: Brewers rookie Jacob Misiorowski took a perfect game into the seventh inning of his second career start, becoming the first pitcher to start his big league career with 11 consecutive hitless innings as a starter since 1900.

title: Fang 1st American in 18 years to win British Am
content: Oklahoma State junior Ethan Fang held off a late charge Saturday with a 5-foot birdie putt on the final hole for a 1-up victory over Gavin Tiernan of Ireland, becoming the first American in 18 years to win the British Amateur.

title: Suarez, managers suspended for Padres-L.A. feud
content: MLB has suspended Padres reliever Robert Suarez for three games (pending appeal) and managers Mike Shildt and Dave Roberts for one each, the aftermath of a feud between the teams that boiled over Thursday night in Los Angeles.

title: Devers, facing Boston, clarifies first-base mindset
content: New Giants slugger Rafael Devers, while still shying away from discussing his past relationship with the Red Sox, did provide some insight into why he is willing to play first base in San Francisco after refusing to do so in Boston.

title: Raleigh hits 2 HRs for 29, breaks Bench's record
content: Cal Raleigh broke Johnny Bench's record for home runs by a catcher before the All-Star break, hitting his major-league-leading 28th and 29th in the Mariners' 9-4 victory over the Cubs.

title: Blackhawks acquire Burakovsky from Kraken
content: The Blackhawks have acquired Andre Burakovsky from the Kraken in exchange for fellow forward Joe Veleno.

title: Senegal women's hoops team denied U.S. visas
content: The prime minister of Senegal says the country's women's basketball team has canceled plans to train in the U.S. after visa applications of five players and seven officials were not approved.

title: 👀 How the Red Sox 'botched' Devers divorce
content: As Devers prepares to play against his former team, a look inside the clubhouse culture that helped cause the divorce.

title: MCWS championship preview: How two classic styles of baseball will clash
content: Why this title series between LSU and Coastal Carolina isn't as Robin Hood against the king as most might assume.

title: Hill or Rountree: Which fighter has the best UFC knockout?
content: Two of elite knockout artists in the UFC's light heavyweight division will square off in the main event at UFC Fight Night, but which fighter has the best KO victory?

title: NBA draft 2025: Final big board for the top 100 prospects
content: Who made big jumps in the top 10? Where do the Duke, Rutgers players rank? Here's our final Top 100 big board. Watch the NBA draft June 25-26 on ABC & ESPN.

title: 5 storylines, 12 players and 1 defining NBA offseason coming up
content: From Giannis' future, to KD's, to all 15 teams in the West competing for the playoffs, here are the biggest stories this offseason. And how they resolve could dramatically impact next season.

title: What gives MLB's best teams their edge? Every current playoff contender's biggest strength
content: For clubs currently leading the postseason hunt, here's the one thing most driving their success so far.

title: Flamengo stun Chelsea in another big Club World Cup upset
content: Chelsea's tournament chances took a serious hit as they were outclassed and outplayed by Flamengo in Philadelphia. Here's what you need to know from Friday in the Club World Cup.

title: 'He can do anything': Why Liverpool spent big to sign Wirtz
content: Liverpool have broken their transfer record to sign Wirtz from Bayer Leverkusen for an initial £100m.

title: Rankings of MLB starters, relievers and their arsenal of pitches over the past three seasons
content: A stat rooted in Game Theory reveals who's maximizing their arsenals, and who's leaving outs on the table.

title: The USMNT is a mess. That's the price of the U.S. becoming a 'soccer country'
content: The more the U.S. cares about soccer and produces better players, the more dysfunctional the USMNT becomes. That's just how it is.

title: PLL Week 4 preview: What to watch at Whipsnakes' homecoming
content: The action heads to Baltimore this weekend. Check here for the full schedule, key stats, injury notes, more.

title: 'The Lakers can finally be run like a real business': Leaguewide reaction to the stunning sale
content: The Lakers have spent decades lagging behind other NBA teams in ways known -- and not. This sale presents a massive opportunity for them to catch up -- and expedite their chase for title No. 18.

title: Inside Chelsea's transfer plan to become 'America's team' with Ohanian's help
content: Chelsea broke the women's transfer world record for Naomi Girma in January and are targeting more USWNT stars, but how can their transfer strategy push them to UWCL glory?

title: Kane lauds Club World Cup, Boca fans' support
content: Harry Kane said that Bayern's Club World Cup win over Boca was "one of the best" atmospheres of his career, adding that he is "loving this tournament."

title: Sources: Onana wants Man Utd stay this summer
content: André Onana is keen to stay at Manchester United despite interest from Monaco, sources have told ESPN.

title: Brazil interested in hosting 2029 Club World Cup
content: Brazil has signalled its intention to host the 2029 Club World Cup, the country's football federation (CBF) has said.

title: Chelsea's Neto: '100%' prefer CWC over vacation
content: Pedro Neto has admitted Flamengo showed more "desire" than Chelsea in Friday's Club World Cup defeat but insisted he would still rather be playing at the tournament than taking a holiday.

title: LAFC out of Club World Cup after late penalty miss
content: LAFC was eliminated from the FIFA Club World Cup after Denis Bouanga had a penalty saved deep into stoppage time of a 1-0 loss to Esperance Sportive de Tunis in Nashville on Friday.

title: Chelsea's Jackson sorry for red: 'I let you down'
content: Chelsea boss Enzo Maresca has said Nicolas Jackson is in a "bad moment" after picking up his second red card in four matches as the Blues lost 3-1 to Flamengo at the Club World Cup.

title: Sources: Wave's Sánchez returning to Tigres
content: San Diego Wave winger and Mexico international María Sanchez's rumored move to Liga MX Femenil's Tigres is now a done deal, sources have told ESPN.

title: Inter's Acerbi threatens PSG fan over UCL taunt
content: Inter Milan defender Francesco Acerbi lost his cool after a Club World Cup fan wearing a Paris St Germain shirt in Seattle taunted him about last month's Champions League final, with the Italian threatening to beat him up if the teasing continued.

title: Who are the best players in the 2026 NFL draft class? We picked the top five at every position

title: Barnwell picks the NFL's top luxuries: The best players at 11 specialized roles
